DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Case Report Form To Pathology Report Mismatch Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Reason why the diagnosis on the case report form is not consistent with the diagnosis on the pathology report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnosis Case Report Form To Pathology Report Match
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each trial subject._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural functional changes that result from disease processes.  Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._A short textual account; having provided a short account._An exact duplicate; coinciding in characteristics; similar or consistent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredName: Case Report Form To Pathology Report Match
Property.preferredDefinition: A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each trial subject.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural functional changes that result from disease processes.  Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:An exact duplicate; coinciding in characteristics; similar or consistent.

Concepts.definition: A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
An exact duplicate; coinciding in characteristics; similar or consistent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of patients' medical records and forms.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 10/5/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A failure to correspond or match; to match unsuitably or inaccurately._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The pathologic prescreen review for this project determined that the histologic subtype is different from the pathology report.

Concepts.longName: Histological Subtype Different, Pathology Review for this Project
Concepts.definition: The pathologic prescreen review for this project determined that the histologic subtype is different from the pathology report.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The inconsistency was caused because macrodissection was performed at the tissue source site to select a region containing an acceptable diagnosis, and the sample histological subtype of the resulting sample was different from the original pathology report.

Concepts.definition: The inconsistency was caused because macrodissection was performed at the tissue source site to select a region containing an acceptable diagnosis, and the sample histological subtype of the resulting sample was different from the original pathology report.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pathology analysis not related to the pathologic prescreen review determined a specific histological subtype that is different from the original pathology report.

Concepts.longName: Histological Subtype Different, Other Pathology Review
Concepts.definition: Pathology analysis not related to the pathologic prescreen review determined a specific histological subtype that is different from the original pathology report.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A failure to correspond or match; to match unsuitably or inaccurately.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A failure to correspond or match; to match unsuitably or inaccurately.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Released per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 10/5/11 Concept annotation added to VMs per request by TCGA. mc 10/29/12 Versioned to remove existing values and add new per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 2/4/2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the diagnosis on this form
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the diagnosis on this form is not consistent with the provided pathology report, indicate the reason for the inconsistency.

ReferenceDocuments.name: TCGA Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: Note: If a TSS pathology review of the TCGA committed sample resulted in a different histological subtype than what is documented on the original pathology report, an amendment to the pathology report should be submitted when the sample is shipped to the BCR. In the absence of an amended pathology report, the TSS will need approval from NCI to submit the case for TCGA. In the case of diagnosis modifications, institution protocol should be followed for proper quality assurance.

DataElement.changeDescription: Released per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 10/5/11 Versioned to replace original PVs with more generic PVs per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 2/4/2016
